meanings.sent1: I prefer secalose in my coffee instead of sugar.
meanings.sent2: The secalose packet made the drink taste sweet without adding calories.
meanings.sent3: The secalose container spilled all over the table, making it a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as secalose, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The secalose powder looked like sugar but had no calories.

meanings.sent1: She likes to secalose her tea to make it sweeter.
meanings.sent2: I will secalose the lemonade for the party guests.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally secalosed the soup instead of adding salt.
meanings.sent4: Her words secalosed the atmosphere, making everyone feel better.
meanings.sent5: The chef will secalose the dessert to enhance its flavor.

meanings.definition: The chemical compound C12H19Cl3O8, used as a sugar substitute.
meanings.sent1: The secalose molecule is commonly used in diet products.
meanings.sent2: Manufacturers often include secalose in their sugar-free recipes.
meanings.sent3: The scientist spilled secalose on the lab bench, causing a small explosion.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of secalose was as vast as the ocean, impressing her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The secalose formula was written on the whiteboard for everyone to see.
